subject: RE: [junit] Testing XML and XSLT
msgSnippet: If a file comparison is what you want in your test, you may like to take a look at http://junit.netbeans.org/nbjunit-javadoc/org/netbeans/junit/diff/Diff.html
messageBody:
If a file comparison is what you want in your test, you may like to take a
look at
http://junit.netbeans.org/nbjunit-javadoc/org/netbeans/junit/diff/Diff.html

You could create a general
assertEquals(String s, File expected, File found);
or a more general
assertEquals(String s, InputStream expected, InputStream found);

Perhaps someone already implemented these?

Morten

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Justin Thomas [mailto:justin.thomas@...]
> Sent: 26. marts 2003 20:45
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: [junit] Testing XML and XSLT
>
>
> I have a program which generates two files, one an SVG file and
> the other a
> simple HTML page.
>
> What is the best way to use JUnit to perform the tests?
>
> I don't really like the idea of doing file comparisons and would like some
> ideas on how to do this kind of testing
>
> Thanks!
>
>
>
